item.title: Unit Testing
item.description: Unit Testing A test is not a unit test if: It talks to the database It communicates across the network It touches the file system It can’t run at the same time as any of your other unit tests You have to do special things to your environment (such as editing config files) to run it. References Michael Feathers. “A Set of Unit Testing Rules”, 2005
